playn.core
Interface Events.Flags

All Known Implementing Classes:
Events.Flags.Impl
Enclosing class:
Events
public static interface Events.Flags

Defines some information for how event processing may be controlled. One instance may be shared among multiple events. TODO: better name than flags? ProcessControls is more accurate but too long.

Method Detail

getPreventDefault

boolean getPreventDefault()
Return whether the default action normally taken by the platform will be prevented.

setPreventDefault

void setPreventDefault(boolean preventDefault)
Set whether the default action normally taken by the platform as a result of the event should be performed. By default, the default action is not prevented.

For example, pressing the down key in a browser typically scrolls the window. Calling setPreventDefault(true) prevents this action.

Note: this must be set from inside the event handler callback (e.g., onKeyUp()). If it is called after the callback has returned, setPreventDefault will have no effect.

getPropagationStopped

boolean getPropagationStopped()
Returns true if the event is eligible to also dispatch to parents of the current layer. If this method returns true and the platform has propagation enabled, then the layer's parent's listeners will also be notified. Otherwise, the event processing will exit after the current layer's listeners have all been notified.

See Also:
Platform.setPropagateEvents(boolean)

setPropagationStopped

void setPropagationStopped(boolean stopped)
Sets whether the event is eligible to also dispatch to parents of the current layer.

See Also:
getPropagationStopped()
